DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of up to 26 weeks of treatment with calcitriol 3 mcg/g ointment when used twice daily, without occlusion, to treat pediatric subjects (2 to 16 years and 11 months of age) with mild to moderate plaque psoriasis.
DOC.brief_title: Long Term Safety and Efficacy Study of Calcitriol 3 mcg/g Ointment in Pediatric Subjects With Plaque Psoriasis
DOC.criteria: Male or female 2 to 16 years and 11 months of age Clinical diagnosis of stable mild to moderate plaque psoriasis Other forms of psoriasis Hypercalcemia Past history of kidney stones Vitamin D deficiency Other concomitant dermatological disease
